content.text: Write two hundred thousand and seventeen in figures
Insert one pair of brackets to make this calculation correct
Solve the equation
The diagram shows a triangle drawn between a pair of parallel lines
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\)
Increase 42 by \(16\%\)
Factorise completely
The area of triangle \(ABC\) is \(27 \mathrm{~cm}^2\) and \(AB = 6 \mathrm{~cm}\)
Calculate the value of \(h\)
Calculate the size of one interior angle of a regular polygon with 40 sides
Solve the simultaneous equations
Without using a calculator, work out \(\frac{5}{6} \div 1 \frac{1}{3}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
Simplify
Alex and Chris share sweets in the ratio Alex : Chris = 7 : 3
Alex receives 20 more sweets than Chris
Work out the number of sweets Chris receives
The length of one side of a rectangle is \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
The length of the diagonal of the rectangle is \(13\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the area of the rectangle
Work out \(\left(3 \times 10^{199}\right) + \left(2 \times 10^{201}\right)\)
Give your answer in standard form
Calculate the area of this sector of a circle
The selling price of a shirt is \(26.50\)
This includes a tax of \(6\%\)
Calculate the price of the shirt before the tax was added
Find the acceleration between 20 and 40 seconds
Find the total distance travelled
The diagram shows the speedâ€“time graph for the first 40 seconds of a cycle ride
The sides of an isosceles triangle are measured correct to the nearest millimetre
One side has a length of \(8.2 \text{cm}\) and another has a length of \(9.4 \text{cm}\)
Find the largest possible value of the perimeter of this triangle
Calculate the value of \(x\)
Calculate the area of the triangle
A model of a statue has a height of \(4\mathrm{cm}\)
The volume of the model is \(12\mathrm{cm}^3\)
The volume of the statue is \(40 500\mathrm{cm}^3\)
Calculate the height of the statue
Differentiate \(6 + 4x - x^{2}\)
Find the coordinates of the turning point of the graph of \(y = 6 + 4x - x^2\)

\(\overrightarrow{MC}\)

The diagram shows a triangle \(OAB\) and a straight line \(OAC\)
\(OA:OC = 2:5\) and \(M\) is the midpoint of \(AB\)
\(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\)
Find, in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\), in its simplest form
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form
A line from the point (2, 3) is perpendicular to the line \(y = \frac{1}{3} x + 1\)
The two lines meet at the point \(P\)
Find the coordinates of \(P\)
Questions 25 and 26 are printed on the next page
Solve the equation \(\tan x = 2\) for \(0^{\circ} \leqslant x \leqslant 360^{\circ}\)
Simplify
